ai.summary: A 12.4 km moderate-length hike departing from Killeter Village and ascending to Causeway Hill, offering a mix of rural lanes, grassland, and open countryside with occasional hilltop views.
ai.terrain_summary: Combination of quiet country lanes, farm footpaths, and grassy field edges. Expect uneven ground, occasional muddy patches, gates and stiles, and a gentle ascent toward the hilltop with potential short steeper sections.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather before you go, as UK conditions can change quickly. Wear sturdy, waterproof footwear and dress in layers. Stay on marked paths, watch footing on uneven ground, and be cautious around gates and livestock. Carry a map and compass or navigation device, and tell someone your planned route and ETA. Bring enough water and snacks, a first aid kit, and a whistle for emergencies. Mobile reception may be limited in remote areas.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or offline navigation device
Fully charged phone and power bank
Headlamp or flashlight for early/late hikes
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn are best; winter can be muddy and conditions may be challenging.

seo.title: Causeway Hill – From Killeter Village (UK) – 12.4 km Moderate Hike
seo.meta_description: Discover a 12.4 km moderate hike from Killeter Village to Causeway Hill in the UK. Terrain overview, safety tips, gear suggestions, and best seasons.
